original_title: Winamp Taken Down: Too Good For This Open Source World
original_content:
If you picked today in your hackerspaces sweepstake on when Winamp would pull their code repository, congratulations! Youre a winner! The source for the Windows version of the venerable music player was released on GitHub three weeks ago, and after some derision over its licence terms, a bunch of possible open source violations, and the inadvertent release of some proprietary third-party code, its been taken down. Were sure that if you still have a burning desire to look at it then it wont be too difficult to find a copy through your favorite search engine, leaving the question of what really just happened.
Its fairly obvious that the owners of the code lacked some level of understanding of just what open source really is, based on their not-really-open licence and all those code leaks. They did back down on not allowing people to create forks, but its evident that they didnt anticipate the reaction they got. So were they merely a bit clueless, or was it all just a publicity stunt involving a piece of software thats now of more historical than practical interest? Its possible well never know, but the story has provided those of us sitting on the fence eating popcorn with some entertainment.
title: WinampコードリポジトリがGitHubで公開されるも短期間で削除
body: WinampのWindows版ソースコードがGitHubに公開され、一部プロプライエタリコードが誤ってリリースされ、「公開ソース」の理解が欠けていたと指摘されました。コード所有者は反応を予期できなかったため、疑問が残りました。
titles: WinampコードリポジトリがGitHubで公開されるも短期間で削除
Winampのオープンソースライセンス問題に見る、コード公開の波紋
Winampソフトウェアのソースコード、意図しない第三者コードも含まれ一時公開
Winampのコード流出にみる、オープンソースへの理解の不足
Winampのコード公開騒動、広報活動なのか歴史的興味対象なのか
